ale and evidence (151)
Although the severe nutritional consequences of HIV infection in adults and children have been 
recognized for many years, gaps remain in the evidence base for defining effective interventions 
to prevent and treat HIV-associated malnutrition in resource-constrained settings. As a result, 
the development and implementation of guidelines on how best to offer nutritional care to HIV-
